item.title: How irretrievable breakdown led to savage separation for Rodgers & Celtic
item.description: The relationship between Brendan Rodgers and Dermot Desmond at Celtic has splintered in unseemly and embarrassing fashion, writes Tom English.

item.title: Man dies after wheelchair collides with car driven by Inter keeper
item.description: A man dies after his electric wheelchair collides with a car driven by Inter Milan goalkeeper Josep Martinez.

item.title: Former Bristol City forward Brown dies aged 42
item.description: Former Bristol City forward Marvin Brown has died from cancer at the age of 42.

item.title: Delap returns as Chelsea aim to solve striker issues
item.description: Rory Delap returns from injury against Wolves in the EFL Cup on Wednesday to a Chelsea attack struggling to find consistency.

item.title: Season of the set-piece - how open-play goals are falling out of fashion
item.description: Set-piece goals have been the story of the Premier League this season. BBC Sport examines their increasing importance.

item.title: Man Utd & Newcastle eye Anderson - Tuesday's gossip
item.description: Manchester United and Newcastle are monitoring Elliot Anderson, Barcelona lead the chase for Mason Greenwood, Jobe Bellingham is not interested in Manchester United, plus more.

item.title: Trafford will be England keeper 'sooner or later'
item.description: Manchester City goalkeeper James Trafford will become England's number one "sooner or later", says boss Pep Guardiola.

item.title: Iceland v Northern Ireland postponed because of snow
item.description: Northern Ireland's Nations League promotion/relegation play-off second leg in Iceland is postponed because of heavy snow.

item.title: A relief Osula did not leave Newcastle - Howe
item.description: Newcastle forward Will Osula, who almost left last month, now looks like the "complete package", says manager Eddie Howe.

item.title: Rangers have 'big belief' after Rohl's first win
item.description: Rangers head coach Danny Rohl says his squad now have "big belief" after the first win of his tenure against Kilmarnock.

item.title: BBC Women's Footballer of the Year contender Patri Guijarro
item.description: Meet Barcelona and Spain midfielder Patri Guijarro, who has been nominated for BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025.

item.title: Best finisher? Toughest opponent? - Shearer answers your questions
item.description: Alan Shearer answers questions from the BBC Sport audience (and Dion Dublin) on Football Focus at Newcastle's St James' Park.

item.title: Super Bowl winner offers to train Kane
item.description: Former Kansas City Chiefs punter and Super Bowl champion Dustin Colquitt says England dootball captain Harry Kane would be "fantastic" in the NFL if he decides to switch to the sport in the future and offers to coach him.

item.title: History maker Cureton on playing football at 50
item.description: Ex-Premier League striker Jamie Cureton tells Monday Night Club on his desire to still play football aged 50, after scoring his debut goal for Kings Park Rangers meaning he has scored in the top-10 tiers of English football.

item.title: Playing England 'will feel like revenge game' for Australia
item.description: Ella Toone says Tuesday's friendly against Australia "will feel like a revenge game for them" after England beat the Matildas in the 2023 World Cup semi-final in Sydney.

item.title: Wilkinson expects 'tough' Wales game against Poland
item.description: Wales boss Rhian Wilkinson expects a tough test from Poland on Tuesday night in Newport as her side seek to end a 10-game winless run.

item.title: Sunderland fans in 'dreamworld' led by 'nice guy' Le Bris
item.description: Sunderland are defying expectations this season, but who is the manager behind their impressive Premier League start?

item.title: England-Australia will feel like revenge game - Toone
item.description: England midfielder Ella Toone says it will "feel like a revenge game" for Australia when the sides meet in their friendly match at Pride Park on Tuesday.

item.title: Vote for your BBC Women's Footballer of the Year
item.description: Voting for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award is now open.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Guijarro
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Barcelona and Spain midfielder Patri Guijarro, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Russo
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Arsenal and England forward Alessia Russo, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Caldentey
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Arsenal and Spain midfielder Mariona Caldentey, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Hampton
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Chelsea and England goalkeeper Hannah Hampton, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Bonmati
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Barcelona and Spain midfielder Aitana Bonmati, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: 2025 BBC Women's Footballer of the Year contenders
item.description: Meet the five contenders who have been nominated for the 2025 BBC Women's Footballer of the Year award.

item.title: Name the England XI that beat Australia at the 2023 World Cup
item.description: For this week's big Tuesday quiz we want you to name the Lionesses who started their side's semi-final with Australia.

item.title: Is masked Premier League star allowed to play in Baller League?
item.description: BBC Sport explains the Premier League rules on whether a Premier League player can really feature in Baller League UK.

item.title: 'Four or five serious bids' for Sheffield Wednesday
item.description: Sheffield Wednesday's joint administrator says they have received "four or five" serious bids and the club could have new owners by the end of the year.

item.title: Celtic replace 'divisive' Rodgers with former boss O'Neill
item.description: Brendan Rodgers resigns as Celtic manager - amid accusations by Dermot Desmond of "divisive, misleading, and self-serving" behaviour - with former boss Martin O'Neill taking over.

item.title: Stole a penguin, jailed in Singapore, now Aberdeen sporting director
item.description: Lutz Pfannenstiel has stolen a penguin, spent 101 days in jail accused of match-fixing, modelled for Armani - and is Aberdeen's new sporting director.

item.title: How Andrews has brought about Brentford's tactical evolution
item.description: Keith Andrews faced a daunting task when he took over at Brentford this summer, but Saturday's win over Liverpool demonstrated how he has successfully gone about his business.

item.title: Juventus sack manager Tudor after seven months
item.description: Juventus sack head coach Igor Tudor with the side eighth in Serie A after weekend defeat by Lazio.

item.title: De Bruyne injures thigh while scoring penalty
item.description: Napoli midfielder Kevin de Bruyne is set for a lengthy spell on the sidelines after suffering a high-grade tear in his right thigh against Inter Milan.

item.title: When is the Carabao Cup quarter-final draw?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at when the quarter-final draw for the 2025-26 EFL Cup campaign is taking place

item.title: We can beat teams in higher leagues than us - Colwill
item.description: Cardiff City's Rubin Colwill is confident that his side can beat Wrexham in the EFL Cup on Tuesday night,

item.title: When Swansea toppled Man City - but Mancini's team beat the rest
item.description: Recalling the day Swansea City humbled title-chasing Manchester City as the teams prepare to meet on Wednesday in the EFL Cup.

item.title: Wales star Ramsey increased reward for missing dog to Â£15,000
item.description: Wales star increases reward for information about his dog Halo, who has gone missing in Mexico.

item.title: Eastbourne to donate Chichester gate receipts to charity in Vigar's memory
item.description: Billy Vigar's former clubs Eastbourne Borough and Chichester City play each other on Tuesday.

item.title: Watch Rodgers' last interview as Celtic manager
item.description: Watch Brendan Rodgers' last interview as Celtic manager, following Sunday's 3-1 defeat by Hearts at Tynecastle.

item.title: Bellingham scores El Clasico winner
item.description: Jude Bellingham assists the first goal and scores the second for Real Madrid as they beat Barcelona 2-1 in the first Clasico of the La Liga season.

item.title: Quality and consistency of delivery key for Arsenal - Walcott
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Theo Walcott says Arsenal's quality and consistency with their set-pieces has enabled them to be so dominant.

item.title: Salah and Van Dijk have not led Liverpool - Rooney
item.description: Former England captain Wayne Rooney says Liverpool's top players are falling short - both in performance and body language - amid the club's poor run of form.

item.title: Villa took advantage of unexpected Man City team selection - Murphy
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy says Aston Villa too advantage of Manchester City's unexpected selection, containing no orthodox defensive midfielder.

item.title: 'The Thomas Frank effect' - but is there more to come from Spurs?
item.description: MOTD pundit Danny Murphy explains why Tottenham's attack will evolve under Thomas Frank, and how he has already fixed their defensive issues.

item.title: When Gazzamania came to Kettering
item.description: Paul Gascoigne was one of the best English players of the last 30 years but his managerial career lasted only 39 days. BBC Sport looks back.

item.title: With 38 points between them - will all three promoted clubs stay up?
item.description: Burnley, Leeds and Sunderland all won again this weekend to go five, six and 12 points clear of the relegation zone. Can all three promoted sides stay up?

item.title: A Welsh rivalry but is Wrexham v Cardiff a derby?
item.description: BBC Sport Wales looks at what gives an edge to this grudge fixture between clubs at opposite ends of the country.

item.title: 'People are afraid' - why 'juggernaut' Arsenal are team to beat
item.description: As Arsenal move four points clear at the top of the Premier League, BBC Sport looks at why teams are "afraid" of them.

item.title: 'Pragmatic' Spurs approach can change when players return - analysis
item.description: Theo Walcott and Danny Murphy discuss how Tottenham's set-pieces led to their win against Everton and suggest Spurs will become more creative when injured players return.

item.title: Arsenal 'suffer every week' to win matches - Arteta
item.description: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta praises Eberechi Eze's "unbelievable technique"after he scored the only goal of a tight game against Crystal Palace to extend their lead at the top of the Premier League table.

item.title: 'The players cannot fight alone' - Pereira on fan reaction to Burnley loss
item.description: Wolves manager Vitor Pereira says it is "normal" for fans to feel frustrated after losing 3-2 to a last-minute goal against Burnley, but says the team need them on their side as "the players cannot fight alone".

item.title: Tottenham focus on set pieces is 'crucial' - Frank
item.description: Tottenham manager Thomas Frank says that set pieces are a key area of focus for his side after Micky van der Ven scores from two corners in Spurs' 3-0 win at Everton.

item.title: Man City fell short on finishing - Guardiola
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says his side performed well in their 1-0 loss to Aston Villa and just fell short on "putting the ball in the net".

item.title: Man Utd midfield connection building in fluidity - Carrick
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Michael Carrick praises the connection and fluidity between Manchester United's midfield in their match against Brighton.

item.title: Why Liverpool's defending against Brentford was 'unacceptable'
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Ashley Williams says Liverpool's defending against Brentford was "not good enough" and resulted in an "unacceptable" goal for Kevin Schade.

item.title: Chelsea's James on love of fashion & friendship with Hamilton
item.description: Reece James has progressed from the Chelsea academy to club captain, overcoming a number of injuries along the way.

item.title: Can Arsenal's defence lead them to title glory?
item.description: Arsenal spent big in the summer to try to improve their attack, but it might be their defence that could end up winning them a first Premier League title in 22 years.

item.title: Fishlock's fab four - pick your favourite goal
item.description: As Jess Fishlock prepares to face Australia on Saturday in her final international, choose the best goal from these four stunners.

item.title: Meet the Sunday league team with 1,800 Premier League appearances
item.description: How do you improve a stellar veteran team who have won back-to-back titles? Recruit a raft of former Premier League and international stars.

item.title: Kane can't stop scoring - is the Ballon d'Or within reach?
item.description: With 23 goals in 15 games for Bayern Munich and England this season, Harry Kane is emerging as an early frontrunner for the 2026 Ballon d'Or.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: What is the Fifpro World XI?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what the Fifpro World XI is, who votes for the award and when the winners will be announced.

item.title: What does it mean when a club enters administration?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at what it means when a club enters administration.

item.title: What is the Premier League multi-ball system?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the rules of the Premier League multi-ball system and what happened in Liverpool's defeat against Manchester United.

item.title: When is the 2027 Women's World Cup qualification draw?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains when the 2027 Women's World Cup European qualification draw takes place and how it works?

item.title: When did a non-Old Firm team last win a Scottish title?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the last time a team other than Rangers or Celtic won Scottish football's top flight division.

item.title: How did internet outage affect West Ham v Brentford?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why the Amazon Web Services global outage affected Brentford's win over West Ham

item.title: What is the manager VAR card being trialled by Fifa?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything Team look at how the Football Video Support system works.

item.title: Rangers 'didn't screw up' head coach appointment
item.description: Chairman Andrew Cavenagh insists Rangers did not "screw up" the process to appoint head coach Danny Rohl but admits it looked "clunky" from the outside.

item.title: What did we learn from Rohl's Rangers unveiling?
item.description: Danny Rohl understands the need to win quickly as Rangers head coach and says he can handle pressure, as chief executive Patrick Stewart and sporting director Kevin Thelwell come under fire.

item.title: Winning & togetherness - Rohl sets out Rangers mission
item.description: Danny Rohl delivers a simple message as he is introduced as Rangers head coach, stating: "We want to win."

item.title: 'Rohl jumps from Wednesday frying pan into Rangers furnace'
item.description: Danny Rohl has taken on one of the toughest managerial jobs in world football by succeeding Russell Martin at Rangers, writes Tom English.

item.title: 'A proud club dragged into gutter'
item.description: Kevin Muscat is the latest to be ruled out of Rangers' manager search - so what do fans make of the process, and who do they want now?

item.title: Villarreal shown 'lack of respect' over cancelled Miami game
item.description: Villarreal say they have been shown "a complete and utter lack of respect" by La Liga over the cancellation of their overseas match against Barcelona in the United States.

item.title: Benitez joins 15th club of career as Panathinaikos boss
item.description: Former Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez has been appointed head coach of Greek side Panathinaikos, the 15th club of his managerial career.

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: Manager Kompany signs new Bayern Munich contract
item.description: Bayern Munich manager Vincent Kompany signs a two-year extension to his contract, keeping him with the German side until June 2029.

item.title: Barca boss Flick to change behaviour 'for grandchildren'
item.description: Barcelona manager Hansi Flick says he does not want his grandchildren to see the behaviour which earned him a red card against Girona on Saturday.

item.title: Keating's England debut & Le Tissier position dilemma
item.description: Khiara Keating makes her debut and Maya le Tissier plays at right-back as Lionesses lose first match since winning Euro 2025 trophy.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
